channel.title: Posts on Maciej Klim
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Maciej Klim

item.title: Uninstalling an app doesn't delete the proof you ran it
item.description: Learn how to analyze the prefetch directory using PECmd.exe.

item.title: Windows is saving every USB storage device you plug in
item.description: Learn how to analyze the registry for USB storage history.

item.title: Your computer knows exactly how much data every single app has sent to the internet
item.description: Learn how to analyze the SRUBD.dat file.

item.title: Your WiFi connection history, exposed
item.description: Use NETSH to see every network you’ve connected to. Passwords in plain text. And even geolocation.

item.title: Phishing Trends: End of 2025 Review
item.description: From fake M365 login pages to QR-code scams. Discover the top phishing trends seen this year.

item.title: CVE 2013-3900: WinVerifyTrust Signature Validation
item.description: When signature validation is lax, detection breaks. See what defenders must do to close that gap.

item.title: CVE 2024-30080: Microsoft Message Queueing (MSMQ) Remote Code Execution
item.description: Unused Windows features can quietly become RCE’s. See how exposed MSMQ services listening on port 1801 put defenders at risk.

item.title: CVE-2023-3438: Unquoted Service Path
item.description: Windows doesnâ€™t forgive sloppy service paths. Learn how a single missing quote lets attackers hijack execution flow and escalate straight to SYSTEM.
